labels.analysis: The MCP Server description focuses on integrating AI-powered automation into smart home systems, allowing control and monitoring of devices via natural language commands. This indicates its primary purpose is to facilitate smart home automation and device management through intelligent interfaces. The available tool (Optional Settings) suggests basic server management functionality but doesn't significantly alter the core automation purpose.
labels.reasoning: The server's primary functionality aligns most closely with smart home automation and AI-powered device management. The predefined category "Operating System" is somewhat relevant due to device control aspects, but "Home Automation" better captures its smart home focus. Since no predefined category perfectly matches "Home Automation," a custom label is justified. No secondary labels are needed as the primary label sufficiently describes the core functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Home Assistant MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @jango-blockchained/advanced-homeassistant-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Integrate AI-powered automation into your smart home. Control devices and monitor systems using natural language commands.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@jango-blockchained/advanced-homeassistant-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: hassToken
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: The token for connecting to Home Assistant API.
